intro: Angraecopsis pobeguinii, commonly known as the Pobeguin’s star orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue with intricate patterns. The plant thrives in the arid and rocky habitats of the south-western part of the island. It produces showy, fragrant blooms that attract specific pollinators, such as moths, due to its nocturnal flowering habit. Angraecopsis pobeguinii is noted for its resilience and is a symbol of the rich botanical diversity found in Madagascar.
